Crimes.Violation_Type: Inadmissibility based on senior government position
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Was the immigration officer's decision to deny permanent residence reasonable?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Section 35(1)(b) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant held a senior position in the Rwandan government during a period of systematic human rights violations; worked closely with individuals implicated in genocide
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Held senior role in Rwandan government during human rights violations
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Seniority in government linked to human rights-abusing regime
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Position in top half of organizational hierarchy
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied in judicial review
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not applicable – no allegation of personal misconduct or misrepresentation
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Organizational charts, evidence of colleagues’ involvement in genocide
Crimes.Application_Basis: Senior official in government involved in human rights violations
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Structural position and association with implicated individuals
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Foreign nationals who are senior officials in governments engaged in human rights violations are inadmissible
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: None found – sufficient evidence to support conclusion
Crimes.Decisional_Body: Immigration officer, reviewed by Federal Court
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of association with human rights violations through high-level government service
Crimes.Cause_Description: Denial due to senior role in Rwandan government during gross human rights violations
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Evaluated based on documentary and structural evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No disputes over authenticity or credibility of evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer reasonably interpreted organizational data and affiliations
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Senior position in violating government triggers inadmissibility regardless of personal conduct

Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility for violating human or international rights
Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Inadmissibility under immigration law for association with human rights violations
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Involved: Paragraph 35(1)(b) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Senior official in government engaged in gross human rights violations
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Evidence of seniority and context of government actions
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Organizational charts, professional associations, historical context
Crimes.Temporal_Context: 1990–1993, prior to and during period of systemic violations
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Whether position qualifies as 'prescribed senior official'
Crimes.Complaint_Issues: Alleged automatic attribution of responsibility due to rank
Crimes.Role_of_Person: Senior official in Rwandan public service
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Prescribed senior official in violating government
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Association with regime committing human rights abuses
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Systematic human rights violations including genocide
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign national applying for immigration benefits

Crimes.Crime_Name: Being a prescribed senior official in the service of a government engaging in systematic or gross human rights violations
Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Immigration inadmissibility based on official status in violating regime
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Senior position in Rwandan government during human rights violations
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of immigration officer's decision
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Proof of seniority and institutional context
Crimes.Nature_of_Participation: Administrative leadership role in central government
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Position within top half of organizational hierarchy
Crimes.Governing_Body: Immigration Officer, subject to Federal Court review
Crimes.Complaint_Issues: Attribution of inadmissibility without personal wrongdoing
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Systematic and gross human rights violations
Crimes.Legal_Basis: IRPA provisions on inadmissibility for senior officials
Crimes.Victim_Basis: Ethnic and political groups targeted in Rwanda
